description: A simple data driven validation utility library

docs.title: creditCard
docs.desc: Validates that the value is some kind of credit card (excludes the visa pan card however)it runs validation in strict mode by default

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The credit card number value to validate
params.name: val

docs.title: date
docs.desc: Validates that the value is some kind of date (short, proper, or normal)

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The date string value to validate
params.name: val

docs.title: cvn
docs.desc: Validates that the value is either a normal or amex CVN number

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The cvn string to run validation against
params.name: val

docs.title: zipOrPostal
docs.desc: Validates that the value is some kind of zip or postal code
examples: zipOrPostal('55555'); // => truezipOrPostal('K1A0B1'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The zip or postal code string to validate
params.name: val

docs.title: hasValue
docs.desc: Validates if the value is actually a value
examples: const result = hasValue('11'); // => trueconst result = hasValue(''); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: hasNumbers
docs.desc: Validates if the value contains numbers or not
examples: const result = hasNumbers('11'); // => trueconst result = hasNumbers('eew2211'); // => trueconst result = hasNumbers('eerrt'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: hasLetters
docs.desc: Validates if the value contains numbers or not
examples: const result = hasLetters('11'); // => falseconst result = hasLetters('eew2211'); // => trueconst result = hasLetters('eerrt'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: hasSpecialCharacters
docs.desc: Validates if the value contains Special Characters
examples: const result = hasSpecialCharacters('11%%$#'); // => trueconst result = hasSpecialCharacters('eew2211!@'); // => trueconst result = hasSpecialCharacters('eerrt'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: hasNumbersOrSpecials
docs.desc: Validates if the value contains Special Characters or numbers
examples: const result = hasNumbersOrSpecials('11%%$#'); // => trueconst result = hasNumbersOrSpecials('eew2211!@'); // => trueconst result = hasNumbersOrSpecials('eerrt'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: hasUpperAndLowerCase
docs.desc: Validates if the value contains Special Characters or numbers
examples: const result = hasUpperAndLowerCase('11%%$#'); // => falseconst result = hasUpperAndLowerCase('Eew2211!@'); // => trueconst result = hasUpperAndLowerCase('eERrt'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isNotTooShort
docs.desc: Validates if the value is longer or equal to the minLen option
examples: isNotTooShort(5, 'the cow ate grass'); // => trueisNotTooShort(5, 'the'); // => false// ORconst check = isNotTooShort(5);check('the cow ate grass'); // => truecheck('the'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The length the value needs to be greater than or equal to
params.name: rule

docs.title: isNotTooLong
docs.desc: Validates if the value is shorter or equal to the maxLen option
examples: isNotTooLong(5, 'the'); // => trueisNotTooLong(5, 'the cow ate grass'); // => false// ORconst check = isNotTooLong(5);check('the'); // => truecheck('the cow ate grass'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The length the value needs to be Less than or equal to
params.name: rule

docs.title: isCorrectLength
docs.desc: Validates if the value is between or equal to the maxLen and minLen options
examples: isCorrectLength({ maxLen: 10, minLen: 1}, 'the'); // => trueisCorrectLength({ maxLen: 10, minLen: 1}, 'the cow ate grass'); // => false// ORconst check = isCorrectLength({ maxLen: 10, minLen: 1});check('the'); // => truecheck('the cow ate grass'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: Object containing the two numbers to stay between
params.name: rule

params.description: The length the value needs to be Less than or equal to
params.name: rule.maxLen

params.description: The length the value needs to be greater than or equal to
params.name: rule.minLen

docs.title: isDate
docs.desc: Validates if a normal date is valid or not

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isDateShort
docs.desc: Validates if a short date is valid or not
examples: isDateShort('1/19'); // => trueisDateShort('13/19'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isDateProper
docs.desc: Validates if a "Proper" date is valid or not
examples: isDateProper('2019/1/2'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isEmail
docs.desc: Validates if a email is valid or not using the email regex
examples: isEmail('dusty@gmail.com'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isNumber
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid number or not
examples: isNumber('2'); // => trueisNumber(2); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isPositive
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a positive number
examples: isPositive('2'); // => trueisPositive(2); // => trueisPositive(-2); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isNegative
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a negative number
examples: isNegative('-2'); // => trueisNegative(-2); // => trueisNegative(2); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isVin
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid vin number
examples: vin('JM1CW2BL8C0127808'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isZip
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a correct American zip code
examples: isZip('44444'); // => trueisZip('232'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isCAPostalCode
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid CA postal Code
examples: isCAPostalCode('K1A0B1'); // => trueisCAPostalCode('44444'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isPhone
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid Phone number

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isLicensePlate
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid Phone number
examples: isLicensePlate('SSS1829'); // => trueisLicensePlate('SSS-1829'); // => trueisLicensePlate('SSSS 188'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isVisaCard
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid Visa credit card
examples: const isVisa = isVisaCard(true);isVisa('4111111111111111'); // => true// ORisVisaCard(true, '4111111111111111'); // => trueisVisaCard(true)('4111111111111111'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: Determines if the card should be strictly validated
params.name: strict

docs.title: isVisaPanCard
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid Visa Pan credit card
examples: const visaPan = isVisaPanCard(true);visaPan('4111111111111111222'); // => false// ORisVisaPanCard(true, '4111111111111111222'); // => falseisVisaPanCard(true)('4111111111111111222'); // => falseisVisaPanCard(false)('4111111111111111222'); // => true// Since the provided number is a fake the luhn algorithm will fail it

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: Determines if the card should be strictly validated
params.name: strict

docs.title: isMasterCard
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid Master card
examples: const master = isMasterCard(true);master('5511111111111111'); // => false// ORisMasterCard(true, '5511111111111111'); // => falseisMasterCard(true)('5511111111111111'); // => false// Since the provided number is a fake the luhn algorithm will fail it

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: Determines if the card should be strictly validated
params.name: strict

docs.title: isAmexCard
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid American Express card
examples: const amex = isAmexCard(true);amex('341111111111111'); // => false// ORisAmexCard(true, '341111111111111'); // => falseisAmexCard(true)('341111111111111'); // => falseisAmexCard(false)('341111111111111'); // => true// Since the provided number is a fake the luhn algorithm will fail it

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: Determines if the card should be strictly validated
params.name: strict

docs.title: isDiscoverCard
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a valid American Express card
examples: const discover = isDiscoverCard(true);discover('6111111111111111'); // => false// ORisDiscoverCard(true, '6111111111111111'); // => falseisDiscoverCard(true)('6111111111111111'); // => falseisDiscoverCard(false, '6111111111111111'); // => true// Since the provided number is a fake the luhn algorithm will fail it

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: Determines if the card should be strictly validated
params.name: strict

docs.title: isBelowMax
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a below the set maximum
examples: const below = isBelowMax(20);below('19'); // => true// ORisBelowMax(20, '19'); // => trueisBelowMax(20)('19'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: isAboveMin
docs.desc: Validates if a provided value is a below the set minimum
examples: const above = isAboveMin(15);above('19'); // => true// ORisAboveMin(15, '19'); // => trueisAboveMin(15)('19'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: simplyValid
docs.desc: The main validation functionality of simply valid

returns.description: Returns an object with a isValid prop telling if validation was a success, and a story which is an array of objects of which validation methods failed

params.description: The main options to setup simply_valid
params.name: options

params.description: The data that we want to run the validation functionality against
params.name: data

docs.title: meetsMinMax
docs.desc: Validates if the value contains numbers or not
examples: const minMax = meetsMinMax({  min: 0,  max: 10});minMax(5); // => true// ORmeetsMinMax({ min: 0, max: 10 }, '11'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

params.description: The min value to compare to
params.name: $0.min

params.description: The min value to compare to
params.name: $0.max

docs.title: meetsYearStandard
docs.desc: Validates if the value is a valid year string
examples: meetsYearStandard('2017'); // => truemeetsYearStandard('17'); // => truemeetsYearStandard('178'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: meetsCVN
docs.desc: Validates if the value is a valid CVN code
examples: meetsCVN('201'); // => truemeetsCVN('1777'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: meetsCVNAmex
docs.desc: Validates if the value is a valid Amex CVN code
examples: meetsCVNAmex('201'); // => falsemeetsCVNAmex('1777'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: meetsTreadDepth
docs.desc: Validates if the value is a valid treaddepth style
examples: meetsTreadDepth('12'); // => truemeetsTreadDepth('AA'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: meetsPassReq
docs.desc: Validates if the value is a valid treaddepth style
examples: meetsPassReq('cOol12$d'); // => true

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: noSpecials
docs.desc: Validates if the value has no special characters
examples: noSpecials('AAAA'); // => truenoSpecials('1122334') // => truenoSpecials('AAA12!#$'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: noNumbers
docs.desc: Validates if the value has no numbers
examples: noNumbers('AAAA'); // => truenoNumbers('1122334') // => falsenoNumbers('AAA12!#$'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test

docs.title: noLetters
docs.desc: Validates if the value has no Letters
examples: noLetters('1122334') // => truenoLetters('AAAA'); // => falsenoLetters('AAA12!#$'); // => false

returns.description: Returns true or false based on the validation test
